intro: Carlquistia muirii, commonly known as the Muir's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the genus Carlquistia. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to survive in harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Carlquistia muirii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
